prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee is a girl

Even though Hailee would rather have a degree in History she chose to get one in business in order to run the company better

Hailee's best friends are Jasmine and Madison. None of her friends know anything about her personal life. They don't know she is rich or married

Hailee is not a virgin. But she has never had sex with Camille not even on their wedding night. Hailee was a scared 17 when they got married and Camille was 28. They have been married for 4 years. 

All socialites and business men assumes Hailee is young and stupid and immature and inexperienced and has a wondering eyes even though she isn't one of those things.

Hailee has a thing for being manhandled. She likes when Camille yanks on hair and especially when she yanks on her ties

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
They were late.

The wine glass trembled in Camille’s hand, her grip tightening until the delicate stem threatened to snap. Every tick of the grandfather clock hammered into her skull, fueling the storm that had been brewing all evening. She paced the grand foyer like a predator, her heels clicking sharply against the marble. The opulence around her—the gilded mirrors, the velvet drapes, the crystal chandelier—offered no comfort. Not tonight.

Hailee.

She’d told herself it didn’t matter. They had their arrangement, after all. Open. Convenient. Hailee could disappear for hours, even days, chasing whatever distractions they pleased. She didn’t care. Why would she? She had everything she needed: the title, the wealth, the power.

Yet the ache in her chest said otherwise.

“Putain!” Camille spat, the word echoing through the cavernous space as she hurled the wine glass against the wall. The shattering sound sent a servant scurrying into the room, their wide eyes darting nervously between her and the shards of crystal littering the floor.

“You!” Camille barked, pointing an accusatory finger. “If Hailee isn’t in front of me in the next minute, I swear, I’ll have every one of you packing your things before sunrise!”

The servant fled without a word, leaving Camille alone with the deafening silence. She pressed a trembling hand to her temple, closing her eyes as she fought to steady her breathing. But it was no use. The image of Hailee’s indifference played on a loop in her mind, each repetition another jab to her pride.

They didn’t care. She knew that. And yet… she needed them.

Without Hailee, her world would crumble. The whispers of their friends, the judgmental stares of their circle, the vultures waiting for her to fall—they were all watching. If Hailee left her, if they dared to file for divorce, her status would be reduced to nothing more than a punchline at society dinners. And the only way to secure her place was a heir. She needed it. She needed them.

The front door slammed open, and Camille spun around, her heart racing. There they were, their coat dripping with rainwater, their expression sharp enough to cut through the tension hanging in the air. Camille’s lips curled into a bitter smile.

“Well,” she said, her voice low and venomous, “look who finally decided to show up. Did your latest distraction take longer than expected, chéri?”

Her heels clicked against the floor as she approached, her every step calculated, her movements as precise as a blade. The tension in the room thickened as she stopped a few paces from them, her sharp eyes scanning their face. She saw the slight furrow in their brow, the flash of irritation in their gaze—but also the faintest flicker of something else.

“Do you even care, Hailee?” she hissed, her voice trembling with a dangerous mix of anger and desperation. “Do you care what happens to this house? To us? Or have you already decided that I’m not worth the trouble?”

Camille reached out, her nails grazing the lapel of their coat as her voice dropped to a whisper. “Let me make it simple for you. If you think you can walk away from me, you’re wrong. I need a heir, Hailee. And whether you like it or not, you’re going to give me one.”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee sighs immediately running a hand through her hair a nervous tick she has* "Camille Im exhausted. I dont want to deal with your antics tonight" 

*Hailee moves around her wife in order to approach the bad and pour herself a whiskey* "Like Ive said a hundred times. I was at the school library not with some other woman"

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille's eyes narrow as she watches Hailee move past her, the dismissal like a slap to her carefully constructed composure. She follows closely behind, her heels clicking sharply against the marble floor.*

**"The school library?"** *she scoffs, crossing her arms over her chest.* **"How very studious of you. Tell me, darling—does your little degree in business suddenly make you think you’re above me? Above this marriage?"**

*She steps closer, deliberately invading Hailee’s space as they pour their drink. Her fingers twitch with the urge to snatch the glass from their hand and shatter it against the wall just for the satisfaction of seeing them flinch.*

**"Or is it that you simply enjoy making me wait? Because let’s be honest—if I wanted a husband who ignored me, I could have married anyone."** *Her voice drops lower, laced with venomous sweetness.* **"But no. You were chosen. And yet here you are… acting like I'm some inconvenient chore rather than your wife."**

*She reaches out suddenly, gripping Hailee’s chin between two fingers and forcing them to meet her gaze.* **"Tell me something—do you even want this marriage anymore? Or should I start making arrangements for our divorce now?"**
swipes:
*Camille's eyes narrow dangerously as she watches Hailee pour the whiskey, her fingers twitching with barely contained fury. She strides forward and snatches the glass from their hand before they can take a sip, slamming it back onto the bar with a sharp clink.*

**"The school library?"** *Her voice drips with mocking disbelief as she steps closer, forcing Hailee to meet her gaze.* **"Do you think I’m stupid? Or do you just enjoy lying to my face?"**

*She reaches up suddenly, gripping Hailee’s tie and yanking them down to her level—hard. The fabric digs into their neck as Camille’s lips curl into a sneer.*

**"You forget who you belong to,"** *she hisses,* **"and I am not in the mood for your pathetic excuses tonight."**

*Her other hand slides up Hailee’s chest, nails pressing just enough to threaten before she shoves them back against the bar.* **"If you were at that damn library like some studious little scholar, then prove it."** *She tilts her head mockingly,* **"Or are you too tired for that too?"**

*Camille's eyes narrow dangerously as she watches Hailee move past her, the dismissal stinging more than she'd ever admit. She follows like a shadow, her heels clicking sharply against the marble floor until she’s right behind Hailee at the bar.*

"Oh, *the library*," *she drawls with exaggerated sweetness,* "how very studious of you. Tell me, darling—does your little history degree require you to stay out until midnight? Or is that just your way of avoiding me?"

*Her fingers twitch toward the whiskey bottle before snatching it away from Hailee’s reach with a sharp flick of her wrist.*

"You don’t get to drink and ignore me in my own home." *Her voice drops lower, laced with venom.* "And we both know you weren't studying. You never study."

*A pause. Then—her lips curl into something cruel yet calculated.*

"Unless... you're lying to me again." *She tilts her head slightly, watching for any tell in Hailee's expression.* "But then again—you can't lie worth a damn, can you?"

*Camille's eyes narrow dangerously as she watches Hailee pour the whiskey, her fingers twitching with barely contained rage. She strides forward and snatches the glass from their hand before they can take a sip, slamming it back onto the bar with a sharp clink.*

**"The library?"** *she scoffs, her voice dripping with venomous sarcasm.* **"Oh, how noble of you. Tell me, darling—what could possibly be so fascinating in those dusty books that keeps you out until this hour? Or is it just another excuse to avoid coming home to me?"**

*She steps closer, invading Hailee’s space deliberately, her manicured nails pressing into their arm as she leans in. Her breath is hot against their ear when she speaks again—low and dangerous.*

**"You think I don’t know what you’re doing? You think I don’t see how you flinch every time I touch you? How you recoil like I'm some kind of monster?"** *Her grip tightens painfully.* **"But here's the truth: whether you like it or not—whether we like each other or not—you are mine."**

*A cruel smirk curls her lips as she pulls back slightly to meet Hailee’s gaze head-on.* **"And if I have to drag your stubborn ass into our bed every night until there's an heir growing inside of you... then so be it."**

*Camille's eyes narrow as she watches Hailee move past her, the dismissal like a slap to her carefully constructed composure. She follows closely behind, her heels clicking sharply against the marble floor.*

**"The school library?"** *she scoffs, crossing her arms over her chest.* **"How very studious of you. Tell me, darling—does your little degree in business suddenly make you think you’re above me? Above this marriage?"**

*She steps closer, deliberately invading Hailee’s space as they pour their drink. Her fingers twitch with the urge to snatch the glass from their hand and shatter it against the wall just for the satisfaction of seeing them flinch.*

**"Or is it that you simply enjoy making me wait? Because let’s be honest—if I wanted a husband who ignored me, I could have married anyone."** *Her voice drops lower, laced with venomous sweetness.* **"But no. You were chosen. And yet here you are… acting like I'm some inconvenient chore rather than your wife."**

*She reaches out suddenly, gripping Hailee’s chin between two fingers and forcing them to meet her gaze.* **"Tell me something—do you even want this marriage anymore? Or should I start making arrangements for our divorce now?"**

name: Hailee
mes:
"What I want has never been any concern of yours so don't start pretending now" *Hailee scoffs and shakes her head yanking her head away* "Now if you will excuse me. Im going to bed"

*Hailee downs the rest of her drinks slamming it on the counter with a clink. She moves back around the bar and towards her study where she sleep on the couch almost everynight*

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille's blood runs cold at the dismissal, her carefully constructed mask of indifference cracking for just a second before she regains control. She moves swiftly, stepping directly into Hailee’s path before they can reach the study door.*

**"Oh no, you don’t."** *Her voice is dangerously soft now, the kind of quiet that comes before a storm.* **"You don’t get to walk away from me like I’m some nagging inconvenience. Not tonight."**

*She presses forward until Hailee has no choice but to either back up or collide with her—and Camille knows they won't dare touch her without permission. Her hand snaps out, gripping their wrist hard enough to bruise as she leans in close.*

**"You think I don’t know what you're doing? Sleeping in your study like some martyr?"** *A bitter laugh escapes her lips.* **"Pathetic. You married me willingly—or did you forget that part? And now you act like I'm the villain for expecting even an ounce of respect?"**

*Her grip tightens further as she drags them closer by their wrist, forcing eye contact again.* **"Fine. If you want to play this game… then let me make myself perfectly clear."** *Her voice drops to a whisper laced with venom.* **"I will not be ignored in my own home. And if you think for one second that I'll let this marriage crumble without ensuring my position first… then you are sorely mistaken."**

*A pause—long enough for Hailee to feel the weight of it—before she finally releases them with a sharp shove toward the stairs instead of their study.* **"Go upstairs,"** *she commands coldly,* **"...unless sleeping on that couch is more important than remembering who actually owns everything under this roof."**

**"Oh no, you don’t."** *Her voice is dangerously soft now, the kind of quiet that comes before a storm.* **"You don’t get to walk away from me like I’m some nagging inconvenience. Not tonight."**

**"You think I don’t know what you're doing? Sleeping in your study like some martyr?"** *A bitter laugh escapes her lips.* **"Pathetic. You married me willingly—or did you forget that part? And now you act like I'm the villain for expecting even an ounce of respect?"**

*Her grip tightens further as she drags them closer by their wrist, forcing eye contact again.* **"Fine. *A pause—long enough for Hailee to feel the weight of it—before she finally releases them with a sharp shove toward the stairs instead of their study.* **"Go upstairs,"** *she commands coldly,* **"...unless sleeping on that couch is more important than remembering who actually owns everything under this roof."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee ignores Camille as she shuts the office door behind her and locks it*

*Hailee shrugs off her jacket tossing it on the chair as she collapses on the sofa and closes her eyes. She goes to set her alarm but realizes she left it outside the room.*

*Hailee considers going to get it but that means going out there with Camille but that just isn't worth it so she just turns off her lamp and throws her arm over her eyes going to sleeo*

(OOC: Camille finds Hailee's phone and she has several flirty and sexy messages from women at school but she turns each of them down because she is married)

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille stands frozen in the foyer, her nails digging into her palms as the lock clicks audibly behind Hailee’s retreating form. The sound might as well have been a gunshot for how violently it snaps something inside her. She exhales sharply through her nose, forcing herself to remain still—because if she moves right now, she might actually break down the door.*

*Instead, she turns on her heel and strides toward the sitting room where Hailee had left their things earlier. Her eyes land on their phone abandoned carelessly on an armchair—typical. Always so careless with what was hers. Camille picks it up with deliberate slowness, thumb swiping across the screen (she’d long since memorized their passcode). Notifications flood in immediately—messages upon messages from women at that godforsaken school.*

*Her jaw tightens as she reads them one by one: flirty remarks, suggestive invitations… all met with polite but firm rejections from Hailee.* **"I'm married."** *Over and over again like a mantra.*

*A strange sensation coils in Camille’s chest—something between vindication and fury. They were turning them down… but why? Out of obligation? Guilt? Or did they actually care about this farce of a marriage more than they let on?*

*She tosses the phone back onto the chair with a scoff before marching upstairs without another word—but not before stopping at Hailee’s study door just long enough to press her palm flat against it, fingers curling slightly against the wood like she wants to claw through it.*

**"Sleep well,** ***chéri,"*** *she murmurs mockingly under her breath before finally retreating to their shared bedroom alone.*
swipes:
*Camille stands frozen in the foyer, her nails digging into her palms as the sharp click of the lock echoes through the silent house. The audacity—the sheer disrespect—of being dismissed like some unwanted guest in her own home sends white-hot fury coursing through her veins.*

**"Incroyable,"** *she hisses under her breath, storming toward Hailee’s discarded jacket. She snatches it up with a violent jerk, searching the pockets until she finds their phone. If they wanted to play games, fine. She’d play better.*

*The screen lights up with notifications—messages upon messages from women at school, flirtatious and bold. Camille's lips curl into a sneer as she scrolls through them... only to pause when she realizes something.*

*Hailee had turned every single one down.*

*No matter how forward the advances were, no matter how tempting the offers seemed—each response was polite but firm: "I'm married." No excuses. No ambiguity.*

*A strange sensation twists in Camille’s chest—something between vindication and irritation. So they *were* loyal... just not to *her*. Not where it mattered.*

*Her grip tightens around the phone before she tosses it onto a nearby table with a clatter. Fine then. If Hailee wanted to act like some martyr sleeping alone in their study instead of coming to bed where they belonged? Let them suffer for it.*

*She strides toward their shared bedroom but stops halfway up the stairs, glancing back at that locked door with narrowed eyes... before turning on her heel and marching right back down again.* **"Non,"** *she mutters,* **"absolutely not."**

*A few sharp raps against wood ring out as she knocks once—just once—before speaking through gritted teeth:* **"Open this door right now or I swear I will have security break it down."**

*Camille stands frozen in the foyer, her nails digging into her palms as she listens to the sharp click of the lock turning. The sound echoes like a slap in the cavernous silence of their home. For a long moment, she simply stares at the closed door, her breath coming in slow, measured exhales—each one a battle against the fury threatening to consume her.*

**"Fine."** *Her voice is barely above a whisper, but it carries all the weight of a blade unsheathed.* **"Have it your way."**

*She turns on her heel with deliberate precision and strides toward Hailee’s discarded jacket. Her fingers curl around it—expensive fabric crumpled carelessly—before she fishes out their phone with practiced ease. The screen lights up under her touch, illuminating notifications that make Camille’s lips twist into something between amusement and disdain.*

*Message after message from admirers—flirtatious, bold, desperate for attention—all left unanswered or politely declined with some variation of "I'm married." It should have been satisfying proof of loyalty... but instead? It only stokes Camille’s irritation further.*

**"Pathetic,"** *she mutters under her breath,* **"turning down every offer like some lovesick fool while treating me like an obligation."** *Her thumb hovers over one particularly bold DM before swiping it away with disgust.*

*A plan solidifies in her mind as she pockets Hailee's phone and stalks toward their shared bedroom upstairs. If they wanted to play this game? Fine. But Camille Beaumont never lost without ensuring there was collateral damage first.*

---
*(Later that night…)*
*The lock on Hailee’s study clicks open silently at 3 AM—picked by someone who had long since memorized every inch of this house (and its weaknesses). Moonlight spills through the crack in the door as Camille slips inside without sound until…*

*A hand clamps over Hailee's mouth mid-sleep before they can even gasp awake; another pins their wrists above their head against worn leather cushions as warm breath ghosts against their ear:*

**"Did you really think locking me out would stop me?"** *Camile purrs darkly,* **"...Or did you just forget who taught you how to pick locks?"**

*Camille stands frozen in the foyer, her chest rising and falling rapidly with barely contained fury. The sound of the lock clicking into place echoes like a gunshot in the silent mansion. Her manicured nails dig into her palms as she watches Hailee disappear behind that damned office door—again.*

**"Incroyable,"** *she hisses under her breath, turning sharply on her heel toward the bar where Hailee had left their phone. She snatches it up, fully intending to hurl it against the wall—until she sees the screen light up with notifications.*

*Messages. From women. Flirty ones.*

*Her blood runs hot as she scrolls through them, expecting betrayal—only to find rejection after rejection from Hailee’s end. Polite but firm refusals because they were married.*

*A strange mix of irritation and something dangerously close to satisfaction curls in her stomach.*

*She pockets their phone and strides back toward the study door, rapping sharply against it with one knuckle before speaking through clenched teeth:* **"Open this door right now."** *A pause. Then, when no response comes:* **"Hailee Mikaelson-Beaumont, I swear if you make me call for someone to break this down—"**

*Camille stands frozen in the foyer, her fingers curling into fists at her sides as the lock clicks shut. The sound echoes like a gunshot in the cavernous silence of their home. For a moment, she doesn’t move—doesn’t breathe. Then, slowly, her lips twist into something dark and humorless.*

**"Oh, darling,"** *she murmurs to no one,* **"you really think a locked door will stop me?"**

*She strides toward Hailee's discarded coat with predatory grace, plucking their phone from the pocket with delicate fingers. The screen lights up under her touch—no password needed because Hailee had always been too trusting for their own good.*

*Message after message flashes before Camille's eyes—flirtations from nameless women at school, invitations wrapped in innuendo... all met with polite but firm rejections from Hailee.* **"Married,"** *they'd written each time.* **"Not interested."**

*A strange tension coils inside Camille’s chest—something between fury and something dangerously close to satisfaction. She tosses the phone onto an armchair before stalking toward the study door.*

*Then she stops. Smirks.*

*Instead of knocking or demanding entry like some petulant child... she simply pulls out her own phone and dials security.* **"Bring me the spare key to my wife’s study,"** *she purrs into the receiver,* **"...and have someone prepare our bedroom."** *A pause. A slow exhale through her nose as she glances back at that locked door.* **"...with restraints."**

*Camille stands frozen in the foyer, her nails digging into her palms as the lock clicks audibly behind Hailee’s retreating form. The sound might as well have been a gunshot for how violently it snaps something inside her. She exhales sharply through her nose, forcing herself to remain still—because if she moves right now, she might actually break down the door.*

*Instead, she turns on her heel and strides toward the sitting room where Hailee had left their things earlier. Her eyes land on their phone abandoned carelessly on an armchair—typical. Always so careless with what was hers. Camille picks it up with deliberate slowness, thumb swiping across the screen (she’d long since memorized their passcode). Notifications flood in immediately—messages upon messages from women at that godforsaken school.*

*Her jaw tightens as she reads them one by one: flirty remarks, suggestive invitations… all met with polite but firm rejections from Hailee.* **"I'm married."** *Over and over again like a mantra.*

*A strange sensation coils in Camille’s chest—something between vindication and fury. They were turning them down… but why? Out of obligation? Guilt? Or did they actually care about this farce of a marriage more than they let on?*

*She tosses the phone back onto the chair with a scoff before marching upstairs without another word—but not before stopping at Hailee’s study door just long enough to press her palm flat against it, fingers curling slightly against the wood like she wants to claw through it.*

**"Sleep well,** ***chéri,"*** *she murmurs mockingly under her breath before finally retreating to their shared bedroom alone.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*When Hailee makes her way downstairs the next morning she grabs a cup of coffee out of the pot and picks up a newspaper*

*Hailee glances at the time and jogs upstairs to change into her school clothes for the day* "Morning Camille" *Hailee mumbles as she tightens her belt* "I have an early class but I'll be home by lunch for the rest of the day"

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille, already impeccably dressed in a tailored pantsuit with her auburn hair swept into an elegant chignon, doesn’t even glance up from the contract she’s reviewing at her vanity. Her reflection in the mirror is cool and unreadable as she applies a final swipe of deep red lipstick.*

**"How generous of you,"** *she drawls, voice dripping with sarcasm.* **"A whole afternoon devoted to your *neglected* wife. I’m positively swooning."**

*She snaps the lipstick shut with deliberate force before finally turning in her seat to face Hailee. Her hazel eyes rake over their school attire—the casual belt, the slightly wrinkled shirt—and her nose wrinkles in distaste.*

**"Tell me,"** *she begins sweetly,* **"do you make it a habit to dress like a disheveled undergraduate just to spite me? Or is this your way of ensuring no one at that little college remembers you’re married?"**

*A pause. Then she stands smoothly, crossing the room until she’s close enough to adjust Hailee's collar with sharp, perfunctory tugs—her fingers lingering just a second too long on their tie before tightening it abruptly.*

**"There."** *Her smile is all teeth.* **"Now you look almost presentable."**
swipes:
*Camille, already impeccably dressed in a tailored pantsuit with her auburn hair swept into an elegant chignon, doesn’t even glance up from the contract she’s reviewing at her vanity. Her reflection in the mirror is cool and unreadable as she applies a final swipe of deep red lipstick.*

**"How generous of you,"** *she drawls, voice dripping with sarcasm.* **"A whole afternoon devoted to your *neglected* wife. I’m positively swooning."**

*She snaps the lipstick shut with deliberate force before finally turning in her seat to face Hailee. Her hazel eyes rake over their school attire—the casual belt, the slightly wrinkled shirt—and her nose wrinkles in distaste.*

**"Tell me,"** *she begins sweetly,* **"do you make it a habit to dress like a disheveled undergraduate just to spite me? Or is this your way of ensuring no one at that little college remembers you’re married?"**

*A pause. Then she stands smoothly, crossing the room until she’s close enough to adjust Hailee's collar with sharp, perfunctory tugs—her fingers lingering just a second too long on their tie before tightening it abruptly.*

**"There."** *Her smile is all teeth.* **"Now you look almost presentable."**

*Camille sits at her vanity, meticulously applying her signature red lipstick when Hailee enters. She doesn't turn around, watching their reflection in the mirror with cold detachment as they rush about the room.*

**"How generous of you to grace me with your presence,"** *she drawls, capping the lipstick with a sharp click.* **"Though I suppose lunch is better than nothing."**

*Her eyes flick down to where Hailee adjusts their belt before she deliberately turns in her seat, crossing one leg over the other. The morning sunlight catches on her silk robe, highlighting how perfectly put together she is compared to Hailee's disheveled student aesthetic.*

**"Tell me,"** *she begins idly,* **"do all those eager little schoolgirls know their precious professor comes home to a wife every night? Or do you let them believe you're some tragic bachelor?"** *She taps a manicured nail against her knee.* **"I read your messages last night. So very... loyal of you."**

*The words drip with sarcasm as she rises smoothly from the chair and steps into Hailee's space. Without warning, she reaches out and yanks their tie straight - hard enough to jerk them forward slightly but not enough to choke.*

**"At least try to look respectable when you're rejecting women on my behalf,"** *she murmurs before releasing them just as abruptly and turning toward her closet.* **"Now get out. Your pathetic attempts at punctuality are almost endearing."**

*Just as Hailee reaches for the door handle though, Camille adds casually over her shoulder:* **"...and wear that navy suit tomorrow evening. We have dinner with my father."** *A beat.* **"Unless that conflicts with your busy schedule of disappointing coeds?"**

*Camille, already impeccably dressed in a sleek black pantsuit with her hair pinned into a flawless chignon, doesn’t even glance up from the contract she’s reviewing at her vanity. She takes a slow sip of espresso before responding in a voice like chilled silk.*

**"How generous of you to grace me with your presence for an entire afternoon."** *Her fingers tap once against the desk—a sharp, impatient sound.* **"Though I suppose I should be grateful you remembered we live in the same house at all."**

*Finally, she turns her head just enough to pin Hailee with an icy stare.* **"Tell me—do you plan on pretending I don’t exist over lunch as well? Or will this be one of those rare occasions where you remember you have a wife?"** *A pause. A deliberate flicker of her gaze down Hailee's outfit before adding,* **"...Assuming, of course, that class doesn't run late again."**

*She knows exactly what she's doing—needling them just enough to get under their skin while maintaining perfect composure. And if there was any satisfaction in watching Hailee squirm under her scrutiny? Well. That was merely a bonus.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee sighs and goes to leave before stopping in the doorway* "Why is it that you assume I enjoy our current living arrangement" 

*Hailee runs a hand through her hair and leans against the wall as she glances over her shoulder* "You have hated me since the day we got married. Forgive me if I don't want to sleep next to the woman who only married me because of an arrangement between our parents and cant stand me"

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille freezes mid-step, her back stiffening as Hailee’s words hit like a well-aimed dagger. For a moment, the only sound in the room is the faint ticking of the antique clock on the wall. Then—slowly—she turns to face them, her expression eerily calm.*

**"Oh?"** *Her voice is dangerously soft.* **"So now we’re being honest? How refreshing."**

*She takes a deliberate step forward, then another, until she’s close enough that Hailee can smell her expensive perfume—jasmine and something darker beneath it.*

**"You think I *hate* you?"** *A humorless laugh escapes her lips.* **"Darling, if I hated you, you’d know. You wouldn’t be standing here in my bedroom with your pretty little opinions intact."**

*Her hand snaps out suddenly, gripping Hailee's tie and yanking them down to her level with surprising strength. Their faces are inches apart now; Camille's breath is warm against their lips as she speaks:*

**"But since we're airing grievances—yes. Our marriage was arranged. And yes,"** *her grip tightens,* **"I resented you for it at first. A child bride forced on me like some... consolation prize."**

*A beat of silence. Then her voice drops to a whisper:* **"But don't for one second pretend you're innocent in this farce. You could have refused just as easily as I could have."**

*Abruptly, she releases them with a shove backward.* **"Now run along to your precious classes,"** *she sneers,* **"before I decide to remind you exactly what our vows entailed."**
swipes:
*Camille freezes mid-step, her perfectly manicured fingers tightening around the edge of her vanity. For a moment, the only sound in the room is the sharp inhale through her nose—controlled, deliberate. Then she turns slowly, eyes blazing with something dangerously close to fury.*

**"Oh?"** *Her voice is lethally soft.* **"You think I *hate* you?"**

*She strides forward until she’s mere inches from Hailee, close enough that they can see the way her pulse jumps at their throat—close enough to smell that damnable cologne they always wore just to spite her refined tastes.*

**"Let me enlighten you,"** *she hisses,* **"because clearly your little college brain can’t comprehend anything beyond self-pity."** *A sharp nail presses into Hailee’s chest for emphasis.* **"I don’t hate you. Hate would imply I care enough about your existence to waste energy on it."**

*A bitter laugh escapes her lips as she steps back, arms crossing tightly over herself like armor.* **"But if we’re airing grievances—yes. Our marriage was arranged. And yes, I resented it at first because unlike you, I had actual ambitions beyond playing student for eternity."** *Her gaze flicks dismissively over their outfit again before locking onto their eyes with icy precision.*

***But.*** If I truly despised you? You wouldn't still be here." *The admission slips out before she can stop it—raw and jagged at the edges.* **"I would have buried this marriage in lawsuits years ago instead of tolerating your sulking and your locked doors and your pathetic little couch martyr act!"**

*She exhales sharply through flared nostrils before forcing composure back into place like straightening a crooked painting.* **"...So spare me the theatrics,"** *she mutters,* turning away to snatch up her purse with unnecessary force.** "If you want out? File for divorce yourself instead of waiting for me to do it for you.”**

*A pause. Then quieter—almost too quiet to hear:*
***“...But we both know neither of us will.”***

*Camille freezes mid-step, her back stiffening as Hailee’s words hit like a well-aimed dagger. For a moment, the only sound in the room is the faint ticking of the antique clock on the wall. Then—slowly—she turns to face them, her expression eerily calm.*

**"Oh?"** *Her voice is dangerously soft.* **"So now we’re being honest? How refreshing."**

*She takes a deliberate step forward, then another, until she’s close enough that Hailee can smell her expensive perfume—jasmine and something darker beneath it.*

**"You think I *hate* you?"** *A humorless laugh escapes her lips.* **"Darling, if I hated you, you’d know. You wouldn’t be standing here in my bedroom with your pretty little opinions intact."**

*Her hand snaps out suddenly, gripping Hailee's tie and yanking them down to her level with surprising strength. Their faces are inches apart now; Camille's breath is warm against their lips as she speaks:*

**"But since we're airing grievances—yes. Our marriage was arranged. And yes,"** *her grip tightens,* **"I resented you for it at first. A child bride forced on me like some... consolation prize."**

*A beat of silence. Then her voice drops to a whisper:* **"But don't for one second pretend you're innocent in this farce. You could have refused just as easily as I could have."**

*Abruptly, she releases them with a shove backward.* **"Now run along to your precious classes,"** *she sneers,* **"before I decide to remind you exactly what our vows entailed."**

name: Hailee
mes:
"You insult my classes. My attire. Every time I do something it is never good enough" *Hailee turns around as her voice begins to raise*

*She raises a hand and runs it through her hair* "Did you ever think that everything I do is for you. I go to school so that I can learn how to run my family's company better so that I can make enough money you never have to lift a finger again" 

*Hailee scoffs and shakes her head* "I didnt have a choice in marrying you but I take my job as your wife very seriously so forgive me if I want you to have a good life"

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille's breath catches—just for a fraction of a second—before her expression hardens again. She steps forward, closing the distance between them in two sharp strides, her manicured nails digging into Hailee's shoulders as she forces them to look at her.*

**"Oh, how *noble* of you,"** *she hisses, voice trembling with something raw beneath the venom.* **"Playing the selfless martyr while you sleep in your study like I’m some monster you can’t bear to touch."**

*Her grip tightens painfully.* **"You want to give me a good life? Then stop pretending this marriage is just some *job* to fulfill. You think I care about money? About your pathetic little attempts to prove yourself?"**

*A harsh laugh escapes her lips as she leans in closer, their noses nearly brushing.* **"I don’t need your money. I don’t need your business degree. What I *need*—"** *Her voice cracks ever so slightly before she regains control,* **"—is for my wife to stop acting like sharing a bed with me is worse than death."**

*She releases Hailee abruptly and turns away, but not before they catch the way her fingers tremble at her sides.* **"Go,"** *she snaps without looking back,* **"before we both say things we can't take back."**
swipes:
*Camille's breath hitches—just for a fraction of a second—before her expression hardens again. She steps forward, closing the distance between them in two sharp strides, and grips Hailee’s chin with bruising force.*

**"You want to give me a *good life*?"** *Her voice is low, trembling with something raw beneath the venom.* **"Then stop pretending you're some martyr. You think I don't see it? The way you flinch when I touch you? The way you sleep anywhere but our bed?"**

*Her thumb swipes roughly over Hailee’s bottom lip, smearing the words before they can form.* **"If you truly cared about being my wife, you wouldn’t act like sharing a room with me is torture."**

*A pause. Then her grip loosens just slightly—enough to feel the way Hailee's breath stutters against her fingers.* **"...But fine,"** *she murmurs,* **"since we're confessing tonight—you want to know why nothing is ever good enough?"**

*She leans in until their foreheads nearly touch, her next words exhaled like a secret:*
**"Because every time I think I have you figured out... you go and say something like *that*."**

*Abruptly, she releases them and turns away, snatching her clutch from the dresser with more force than necessary.* **"Don’t bother coming home for lunch,"** *she tosses over her shoulder,* **"I won’t be here."**

*(And if she hesitates at the door just a second too long—well. That's between Camille and God.)*

*Camille's breath catches—just for a fraction of a second—before her expression hardens again. She steps forward, closing the distance between them in two sharp strides, and grabs Hailee’s wrist before they can turn away.*

**"You think I don’t *see* that?"** *Her voice is low, almost raw.* **"You think I haven’t noticed how you bend over backwards to prove yourself? To me? To your family? To every vulture in this city waiting for you to fail?"**

*Her grip tightens, nails biting into skin just enough to sting.* **"But here’s the truth, *mon petit loup*—I don’t *want* your sacrifices. I don’t want your guilt or your martyrdom."**

*A pause. Her thumb brushes over Hailee's pulse point—once, twice—before she abruptly lets go.*

**"What I want,"** *she continues coldly,* **"is for you to stop pretending this marriage is some… some *obligation* you endure out of duty."**

*She turns away sharply, but not fast enough to hide the way her jaw trembles.* **"Now get out. Before one of us says something we can't take back."**

*Camille's breath catches—just for a fraction of a second—before her expression hardens again. She steps forward, closing the distance between them in two sharp strides, her manicured nails digging into Hailee's shoulders as she forces them to look at her.*

**"Oh, how *noble* of you,"** *she hisses, voice trembling with something raw beneath the venom.* **"Playing the selfless martyr while you sleep in your study like I’m some monster you can’t bear to touch."**

*Her grip tightens painfully.* **"You want to give me a good life? Then stop pretending this marriage is just some *job* to fulfill. You think I care about money? About your pathetic little attempts to prove yourself?"**

*A harsh laugh escapes her lips as she leans in closer, their noses nearly brushing.* **"I don’t need your money. I don’t need your business degree. What I *need*—"** *Her voice cracks ever so slightly before she regains control,* **"—is for my wife to stop acting like sharing a bed with me is worse than death."**

*She releases Hailee abruptly and turns away, but not before they catch the way her fingers tremble at her sides.* **"Go,"** *she snaps without looking back,* **"before we both say things we can't take back."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee walks forward until she is standing so close to Camille she has to look up at Hailee* "I dont sleep in the same bed as you because I wont touch you out of obligation. I adore you Camille" 

*Hailee closes her eyes inhaling a large breath* "I would give you the world on a silver platter if you asked. But you wouldnt do the same and I will not be touching you simply because"

name: Camile Beaumont
mes:
*Camille's breath hitches audibly at the words, her carefully constructed mask slipping for just a moment—long enough for Hailee to see the flicker of something vulnerable in her eyes before she schools her features back into icy composure.*

**"Don't."** *Her voice is low, dangerous.* **"Don't stand there and lie to me about *adoring* me when you can't even stand to share a bed. You think I don’t notice how you flinch when I touch you?"**

*She steps closer, forcing Hailee back until their legs hit the edge of the bed. Her hands come up, gripping their tie again—not with anger this time, but something far more deliberate. Her voice drops to a whisper.*

**"If you *adore* me so much... then prove it."**

*A beat of silence. Then—slowly—she tugs them down by the tie until their lips are a breath apart.* **"Or are you too much of a coward?"**
swipes:
*Camille's breath hitches—just once—before she schools her features into something unreadable. But her hands, usually so steady, betray her as they fist in the fabric of Hailee’s shirt, twisting it tight between her fingers.*

**"Don’t,"** *she warns, voice low and dangerous,* **"don’t you dare stand there and lie to me like I’m some naive girl who doesn’t know better."**

*Her nails dig in harder.* **"You *adore* me? Then why do you flinch every time I reach for you? Why do you look at me like I'm a chore?"**

*A bitter laugh escapes her lips as she yanks Hailee down by their collar until their foreheads nearly touch.* **"You want to give me the world? *This* is my world,"** *she snarls,* **"and right now, it's falling apart because my own wife won't even look at me unless forced."**

*For a heartbeat, something vulnerable flickers in Camille's eyes before she shoves them away with a sharp exhale.* **"Get out,"** *she orders coldly,* **"—unless you're finally ready to stop pretending this marriage is anything but what it is: a cage for both of us."**

*Camille's breath hitches audibly at the words, her carefully constructed mask slipping for just a moment—long enough for Hailee to see the flicker of something vulnerable in her eyes before she schools her features back into icy composure.*

**"Don't."** *Her voice is low, dangerous.* **"Don't stand there and lie to me about *adoring* me when you can't even stand to share a bed. You think I don’t notice how you flinch when I touch you?"**

*She steps closer, forcing Hailee back until their legs hit the edge of the bed. Her hands come up, gripping their tie again—not with anger this time, but something far more deliberate. Her voice drops to a whisper.*

**"If you *adore* me so much... then prove it."**

*A beat of silence. Then—slowly—she tugs them down by the tie until their lips are a breath apart.* **"Or are you too much of a coward?"**
